alert.note: Alert for Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 3:22PM EST until December 30 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Wanaque River At Wanaque Dam affecting Passaic County. For the Wanaque River...including Wanaque Dam...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wanaque River at Wanaque Dam. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Open adjacent land begins to flood. Waters rise around Wilderness Island Park. At 6.0 feet, John E. Murrin Park begins to flood. Hershfield Park floods. The athletic fields begin to take on water. Parking lots and Hershfield Park Place floods. Carlough Field floods. At 7.0 feet, Back Beach Park in Wanaque begins to flood. The light industrial area off of Lakeside Avenue in Pompton Lakes floods. VFW Way in Pompton Lakes begins to flood. Backyards flood on Henderson Court and Hill Court in Pompton Lakes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:10 PM EST Thursday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:10 PM EST Thursday was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.7 feet on 05/17/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Wanaque River Wanaque Dam 6.0 6.0 Thu 3 pm 6.6 5.4 6.7 1am 12/29 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM EST.
